tabs.label: What Happens After Expungement is Granted?

list.title: Record Sealing
list.description: Your records are sealed from public access.

list.title: Legal Disclosure
list.description: You can legally state that you have no criminal record on most applications.

list.title: Exceptions
list.description: Certain agencies may still access your records under specific circumstances.

tabs.label: Who Can Still See Expunged Records?

list.title: Law Enforcement Agencies
list.description: For investigations or sentencing in future cases.

list.title: Certain Government Agencies
list.description: Particularly those involving employment in law enforcement or judiciary positions.

tabs.label: Can Expungement Be Reversed?
tabs.desc: Expungements are generally permanent but may be reversed if:

list.title: False Information
list.description: The expungement was granted based on inaccurate information.

list.title: New Convictions
list.description: Committing another offense could impact the status of your expunged record.
